questions.question_text:
How should a Data Analyst configure the reference lines so that they appear as such on the following chart?

//IMG//

choices.C: Select any value between a fixed range of 1 to 100.
choices.B: Select only values that appear in the data whenever the data refreshes.
choices.A: Type any value into the parameter.
choices.D: Select only values that appeared in the data when the parameter was created.

questions.question_text:
A Data Analyst configures the When Workbook Opens option in the allowable values section when creating a parameter.

What is a user of a workbook able to do?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. Select only values that appeared in the data when the parameter was created.

Explanation:
When configuring the When Workbook Opens option in the allowable values section of a parameter in Tableau, the parameter values are determined by the data that is available at the time the workbook is first opened. This means that the user will only be able to select the values that were present in the data when the parameter was initially created or loaded.

This behavior ensures that the parameter is tied to the data available at the time the workbook is first loaded, and the available values will not update dynamically based on data changes after that point unless the workbook is re-opened and the parameter is refreshed.

Selected Answer: B
B is the right answer. Parameter value will change whenever data refreshes

Selected Answer: B
I think B is correct

Selected Answer: D
When Tableau Workbook Opens option in the allowable values section for a parameter restricts the user to only select values that were present in the data source at the time the workbook was initially opened.

Selected Answer: B

questions.question_text: When using the INCLUDE Level of Detail (LOD) calculation where should the dimension be located?

You publish a dashboard that uses an extract. The extract refreshes every Monday at 10:00.
You need to ensure that the extract also refreshes on the last day of the month at 18:00.
What should you do?

choices.C: From Tableau Desktop, open the Publish Workbook dialog box and configure the schedule.
choices.A: From Tableau Server, select the workbook, select Refresh Extracts, and then add a new extract refresh.
choices.D: From Tableau Server, select Schedules, find the schedule of the extract, and change the frequency to the last day of the month.
choices.B: From Tableau Server, select Schedules, and change the priority of the existing schedule.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
To ensure that the extract refreshes on the last day of the month at 18:00 in addition to the existing schedule, you should:

**A. From Tableau Server, select the workbook, select Refresh Extracts, and then add a new extract refresh.**

This allows you to add an additional refresh schedule without altering the existing one.

Selected Answer: A
You need to ensure that the extract also refreshes on the last day of the month at 18:00
=>
A. From Tableau Server, select the workbook, select Refresh Extracts, and then add a new extract refresh.
the answer correct this is A, because que question require that refresh in two moments, every Monday at 10h and the last day of the month at 18h.

Selected Answer: A
Answer should be A: We want to add a second, additional schedule and not to replace the existing one.
A should be the the correct answer. We can add more than one schedule to an extract. Changing the existing one will change the frequency to the new one
